clinical_study.brief_title: Fludarabine, Cyclophosphamide, and Alemtuzumab in Patients With B-cell Chronic Lymphatic Leukemia (B-CLL)
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Phase II Trial of Fludarabine and Cyclophosphamide in Combination With Alemtuzumab (FC-Cam) for Patients With Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia - CLL-2L Protocol of the German CLL-Study Group (GCLLSG)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the short term efficacy of a combination immunochemotherapy in patients with relapsed B-cell chronic lymphatic leukemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate (complete and partial response rate)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the end of the last cycle
primary_outcome.description: Response Evaluation has to be done according the the NCI guidelines

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days following the last dose of FCCam
28 days after the end of the last cycle

secondary_outcome.measure: Response rate in biological defined risk groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the end of the last cycle
up to 36 months after the end of treatment
up to the last day of the last given cycle (day 28 of the 6th cycle)
up to 36 months after the end of treatment

arm_group.description: After an initial subcutaneous dose escalation of alemtuzumab over 2 days, 30 mg alemtuzumab s.c., cyclophosphamide 200 mg/m2 i.v. and 25 mg/m2 fludarabine i.v. were administered on three consecutive days. Treatment was repeated after 28 days for up to six cycles

intervention.description: After an initial subcutaneous dose escalation of alemtuzumab over 2 days, 30 mg alemtuzumab s.c., cyclophosphamide 200 mg/m2 i.v. and 25 mg/m2 fludarabine i.v. were administered on three consecutive days. Treatment was repeated after 28 days for up to six cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- B-CLL in need of treatment
- One or two prior prior therapies
- WHO performance status 0-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serum creatinine > 1.5 ULN
- Major organ dysfunctions
- Pregnant or nursing
